handist.collections.dist

Interface RangeRelocatable<R>

  • Type Parameters:
    R - Type of the range used to identify multiple objects
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CachableChunkedList, DistChunkedList, DistCol

    public interface RangeRelocatable<R>
    Interface defining a number of methods allowing the transfer of data objects between the local containers of a distributed collection.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Collection<R> getAllRanges()
      Obtain all the ranges on which this instance has mappings
      default void moveRangeAtSync(Collection<R> ranges, apgas.Place destination, MoveManager manager)
      Marks all the objects contained in all the ranges for transfer to the specified destination.
      default void moveRangeAtSync(Collection<R> ranges, RangedDistribution<R> destination, MoveManager manager)
      Marks all the elements in the provided ranges for transfer using the specified RangedDistribution.
      void moveRangeAtSync(R range, apgas.Place destination, MoveManager manager)
      Marks the objects in the specified range for transfer to the specified destination.
      default void moveRangeAtSync(R range, RangedDistribution<R> destination, MoveManager manager)
      Marks the elements in the provided range for transfer using the specified RangedDistribution.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllRanges

        Collection<R> getAllRanges()
        Obtain all the ranges on which this instance has mappings
        Returns:
        collection of ranges

      • moveRangeAtSync

        default void moveRangeAtSync(Collection<R> ranges,
                             apgas.Place destination,
                             MoveManager manager)
        Marks all the objects contained in all the ranges for transfer to the specified destination. The transfer will be performed the next tim the provided manager's CollectiveMoveManager.sync() method is called.

        The default implementation consists in repetitively calling moveRangeAtSync(Object, Place, MoveManager) for each individual range. Implementations are free to use a more efficient design.

        Parameters:
        ranges - collections of ranges that describe objects to transfer
        destination - the place to which the objects should be transfered
        manager - the manager in charge of performing this batch of transfers

      • moveRangeAtSync

        default void moveRangeAtSync(Collection<R> ranges,
                             RangedDistribution<R> destination,
                             MoveManager manager)
        Marks all the elements in the provided ranges for transfer using the specified RangedDistribution. The provided ranges may be split into multiple sub-ranges to be transfered to different destinations. The actual transfer will be performed when the CollectiveMoveManager.sync() method of the provided manager is called
        Parameters:
        ranges - ranges considered for transfer
        destination - function which given a range will indicate where the elements of this range should be relocated.
        manager - manager in charge of performing the object transfer

      • moveRangeAtSync

        void moveRangeAtSync(R range,
                     apgas.Place destination,
                     MoveManager manager)
        Marks the objects in the specified range for transfer to the specified destination. The transfer will be performed when the CollectiveMoveManager.sync() is called.
        Parameters:
        range - the range of objects to transfer
        destination - the destination of the objects
        manager - the instance in charge of handling a batch of object tranfers

      • moveRangeAtSync

        default void moveRangeAtSync(R range,
                             RangedDistribution<R> destination,
                             MoveManager manager)
        Marks the elements in the provided range for transfer using the specified RangedDistribution. The provided range may be split into multiple sub-ranges to be transfered to different destinations. The actual transfer will be performed when the CollectiveMoveManager.sync() method is called.
        Parameters:
        range - the range of entries to transfer
        destination - function creating a map from ranges to Place
        manager - the manager in charge of the transfer
